snippet: An abrupt change in tone was set last week in Moscow, muting the anti-American talk that began 11 months ago, when Mr. Putin first accused the U.S. of stirring up protests.
abstract: Memo From Moscow; Russia has undergone abrupt positive shift in attitudes toward United States in weeks since Pres Obama was re-elected, opening communications between Moscow and Washington; change signals both relief that Mitt Romney did not win and hopes of advancing Russia's interests in renewed relations with Obama.
lead_paragraph: An abrupt change in tone was set last week in Moscow, muting the anti-American talk that began 11 months ago, when Mr. Putin first accused the U.S. of stirring up protests.

headline.seo: Moscow Reopens a Communication Channel With Washington
headline.main: Frosty Relations With Russia Begin to Thaw After Obama’s Re-election
headline.print_headline: Frosty Relations With Russia Begin to Thaw After Obama’s Re-election
